alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Montezuma County through 330 PM MDT... At 253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Dolores, or 31 miles northwest of Durango. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Montezuma County. This includes Colorado 145 between mile markers 13 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
